attributes.action: Recognise that members of parliament should never vote on legislation based on their own religious beliefs as the majority of the constiuents they represent will not follow the same religion as the MP if they have any belief at all.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As the UK has no state religion and is deemed to have a secular government religious belief should have no influence over legislation enacted in Parliament. If any MP cannot represent the majority of his electors then he should resign rather than vote on the instructions of a "higher" being's representative on earth.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
